content: a retro take on granny squares materials & written directions mabel yarn malabrigo silky wool 2 skeins border color bc 4 partials for square colors sc1 sc2 etc my humble entry for several events shown as bc marron oscurro sc1 lettuce sc2 during the first international camote sc3 cloudy sky sc4 raspberry ravelympics lastly the designer s discus hook size g example shown in size i i m new to crochet and welcome level adventuresome beginner feedback crochet a total of 16 granny squares with 3 color rounds 4 each of sc1+sc2 sc3+4 sc1+sc4 sc2+sc3 rotating every two between start colors for a total of 8 differently colored squares work one last round on all squares of bc sew together in a random order in a zig zag pattern so that no two alike squares are touching beg working edging depending on how you have sewn your squares together you may have a varying number of st on each exterior edge that s okay work the edging so that it is as even as you can make it adding a stitch at the exterior corners and decreasing with a slip_stitch or even a skipped stitch in the interior corners round 1 & 2 using single_crochet work 2 rounds around entire scarf taking care to skip one stitch in the interior corners so work will lay flat and working 2 single_crochet in each outside corner so that they will remain square at the points round 3 chain 4 double_crochet into 3rd st chain 3 work 3 double_crochet onto the just formed double_crochet *double_crochet into 3rd stitch chain 3 double_crochet 3 onto just formed double_crochet* repeat from * to * until a corner credits califibercation on ravelry made a granny square scarf in silky merino and i just had to make one - differently of course a jonquil mom design by jenny raymond www jenraymond blogspot com mabel scarf pg 1 by jenny raymond mabel scarf pg 2 by jenny raymond mabel written directions cont mabel charts --on interior corners end with the 3rd double_crochet into 3rd stitch sl 1-2 and chain 4 continuing from * main edging to * until an exterior corner --on exterior corners work 2 repeats in subsequent stitches not skipping 2 st to work in 3rd st but rounding the corner smoothly then continue from * to * until an interior corner pull yarn through and secure by weaving in the tail block to shape interior corner granny square colors chart continue one more round in like with border color exterior corner mabel scarf pg 3 by jenny raymond mabel scarf pg 4 by jenny raymond
